page.title: 11WATER SUPPLY
page.content: For many years Holcombe Rogus has had a real problem because of a shortage of water.We think that this must have been a problem for many centuries as there is only one small stream near the village and there are several places where water fountains have been built into the village walls.The real problem in recent times is that the village is only fed by a 5 centimetre water main and the reservoir which supplied the village was 9 miles away and almost exactly the same height as our village.This meant that even when we filled our small school swimming pool,automatic washing machines in the village would often refuse to work.Two years ago,South West Water fixed up a new bore hole at Hockworthy to supply us with water.This now works well.
